ygData.subject: Re: The Awakening
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson listens to Perceptor.  With a heavy heart and sympathy for Nightlight, he tries to sit up and then puts his feet onto the ground for the first time

Tucson listens to Perceptor.  With a heavy heart and sympathy for Nightligh=
t, he tries to sit up and then puts his feet onto the ground for the first =
time since he had gone off line to rescue Rodimus. That spark in his chest,=
 the one that pulsated throughout the duration of the rescue, had not finis=
hed pulsating as yet.  He puts his hand on his chest, sensing why and how h=
e could have some of that spark left over after what he had just gone throu=
gh.  he turns his head over to Rodimus and gently puts a hand on his should=
er.

" I won't sit here and watch Nightlight slip away from you.  After all=
, compassion has no end."

He replies in what seems like a riddle of sorts.=


" Stanton, which room is Nightlight in?"

Barely able to stand up, Tucson=
 stumbles as he rights himself up on his feet.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.c=
om, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> Rodimus Prime sat there =
on the bed listening carefully to Perceptor
> and Kup as they spoke, especi=
ally Perceptor's confessions as to what
> he had done to Nihtlight. He coul=
d not help but feel a stab of guilt
> for his role in the whole thing. Yes =
he was under the control of the
> Predacon shell program, but still he coul=
d feel guilt piercing him
> like a white hot blade. For the moment he could=
 say nothing, but the
> anguish on his face spoke volumes!
> 
> "What can b=
e done to help her now?" Santon said as he looked at
> Perceptor, a brief l=
ook of fear for Nightlight and discust for what
> had happened to her flash=
ing across his features. "How much damage do
> you do to her?"
> 
> Legacy,=
 who had been standing in the shadows up to this time, looking
> more like =
a weapon of war than doctor looked at Perceptor, his single
> optic glowing=
 brightly and steadily, his piercing gaze observing
> Perceptor thoughtfull=
y, "Perhaps she sould be brought here so that her
> status can be ascertain=
ed?"
> 
> Meanwhile Torca, who had been observing nodded to Tuscon, his gre=
at
> horned head almost scraping the cieling as he advised them to wait
> b=
efore they had thier briefing. "You are correct Tuscon." he said, his
> dee=
p voice filling the room. "I shall wait for a short time. However
> the cou=
ncil's message will not wait long."
> 
> Torca turned to leave, he could se=
e Silverbolt standing just outside
> the medical chamber still looking thro=
ugh the glass. He had left
> Silverbolt in charge of the Fuzors while he ha=
d been away, now it was
> time to catch up.
> 
> He stepped out of the and =
into the observation room, "Silverbolt."
> Torca said as he moved his large=
 bulk through the doorway followed by
> Bantor. "It has been some time."
